description: CYCLE 1: The sector_id determines the clearance_level. Each sector has a fixed required security clearance.
CYCLE 1: The clearance_level determines the officer_id. Specific clearance levels are overseen by a single specific officer.
CYCLE 1 (CLOSING): The officer_id determines the sector_id. Each officer is permanently assigned to command exactly one sector.
COMPOSITE DEPENDENCY: The combination of sector_id and officer_id determines the access_code_prefix. This tests multi-column consistency.
REVERSE DEPENDENCY: The access_code_prefix determines the clearance_level. The code implies the security level directly.
CARDINALITY STRESS: sector_id must NOT be unique. High repetition is required to test consistency across multiple rows.
CARDINALITY STRESS: officer_id must NOT be unique. High repetition is required.
CARDINALITY STRESS: access_code_prefix must NOT be unique. Even the generated codes must repeat to verify reverse consistency.
